subject: Business
title: Sustainability in Supply Chains
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sustainability in Supply Chains usable.

hook.text: A pair of jeans uses 7,500 liters of water to produce. Most of that water use is invisible to the buyer.

buildup.text: Supply chains account for over 80% of most companies' total carbon emissions â€” far more than offices or factories.

discovery.text: Scope 3 emissions (supply chain) are the hardest to measure and the largest category for most businesses.

twist.text: Consumers demand sustainability, but few will pay more. The cost pressure falls entirely on the supply chain.

climax.text: IKEA aims for a fully circular supply chain by 2030: every product designed for reuse, repair, or recycling.

punchline.text: The greenest supply chain isn't the one that offsets.

quiz.question: What percentage of a company's carbon emissions typically come from its supply chain?
